Pre-Game Insights: Oklahoma City Thunder (3-0, first in the Western Conference) will face San Antonio Spurs (1-2, 12th in the Western Conference) in a conference matchup.
Oklahoma City Thunder had a strong performance last season with a 57-25 overall record and 36-16 in Western Conference action.
The Thunder averaged 120.1 points per game while shooting 49.9% from the field and 38.9% from behind the arc last season.
San Antonio Spurs finished the previous season with a 22-60 overall record and 14-37 in Western Conference games.
The Spurs averaged 7.1 steals, 6.3 blocks, and 14.6 turnovers per game last season.
Injuries for the Thunder include Kenrich Williams (knee), Isaiah Hartenstein (hand), Jaylin Williams (hamstring), and Nikola Topic (ACL).
Injuries for the Spurs include Devin Vassell (foot) and Tre Jones (ankle).
